lines.text: Yesiree. I'm a young guy that knows all the answers and got my whole life before me. Yeah, and I'm all washed up with mugs. I know I came from the gutter, but I'm steppin' right out of it. I'm gonna meet some real people, do something worthwhile, amount to somethin'!
When you meet these people, what are you gonna talk about? Machine guns and beer?

Oh, I'll manage to talk to them all right, and they'll listen. Say, I've been readin' a lot. I've been studyin'. I ain't been wastin' my time these last months. Whattaya think I've been readin' in all them books for? Here!
[Indicating "Plato's Republic"]

Greek philosphy! Pluto! Yeah, I bet you thought Pluto was a waiter. Ah, I'm just crawlin' with education. I've been readin' all them Greeks. They do plenty besides shinin' shoes and runnin' lunchrooms.

[Pointing at a Cubist painting]
You ever see anything like that before?
Not since I been off cocaine.
No, dumb head! I suppose you think that's a cat havin' a fit in a bucket of tomato ketchup. Well, it ain't! That's art!
The toughest mug in Chicago comes out here and gets trimmed by a lot of fags with handkerchiefs up their sleeves.
Say, what's that?
That's a famous Siamese beauty.
Where's the other one?
What?
I always thought they was twins.
I'm in love with a girl - a lady, very rich, fine family, swell education - everything that I ain't got.
I see.
Well, anyhow, I'm a pretty tough mug myself. I came from the gutter, and I guess you can still smell it on me. The only school I went to is reform school.
Hey, Bugs, take dese while you can still smell 'em.
I'm gonna mingle with the upper classes. I'm gonna be a gentleman!

[after he hears him ordering from a waiter in French]
Where did you learn to talk this monkey jabber?
I used to have 10% of a French dame.
Hey, what state's California in?
Texas, ya' dummy.
That's right.
